trans-unit.source: Start Stream Analytics Job
trans-unit.target: Start Stream Analytics Job

trans-unit.source: Deploys and starts a Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: Deploys and starts a Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Start Stream Analytics Job</embeddedLabel> request is specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Start Stream Analytics Job</embeddedLabel> request is specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: For headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to Stream Analytics jobs, see <externalLink><linkText>Common parameters and headers</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/8d088ecc-26eb-42e9-8acc-fe929ed33563</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to Stream Analytics jobs, see <externalLink><linkText>Common parameters and headers</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/8d088ecc-26eb-42e9-8acc-fe929ed33563</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.
trans-unit.target: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.

trans-unit.source: For additional details, see <externalLink><linkText>Authenticating Azure Resource Manager requests</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790557.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For additional details, see <externalLink><linkText>Authenticating Azure Resource Manager requests</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790557.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: https://managment.azure.com/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/resourceGroups/{resource-group-name}/providers/Microsoft.StreamAnalytics/streamingjobs/{job-name}/start?api-version={api-version}
trans-unit.target: https://managment.azure.com/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/resourceGroups/{resource-group-name}/providers/Microsoft.StreamAnalytics/streamingjobs/{job-name}/start?api-version={api-version}

trans-unit.source: Replace {subscription-id} with your subscription ID.
trans-unit.target: Replace {subscription-id} with your subscription ID.

trans-unit.source: Replace {resource-group-name} with the name of the resource group that this job will belong to.
trans-unit.target: Replace {resource-group-name} with the name of the resource group that this job will belong to.

trans-unit.source: For more information about creating resource groups, see <externalLink><linkText>Using resource groups to manage your Azure resources</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/azure-preview-portal-using-resource-groups/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about creating resource groups, see <externalLink><linkText>Using resource groups to manage your Azure resources</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/azure-preview-portal-using-resource-groups/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Replace {job-name} with the name of the Stream Analytics job that you are starting.
trans-unit.target: Replace {job-name} with the name of the Stream Analytics job that you are starting.

trans-unit.source: Replace {api-version} with 2015-06-01 in the URI.
trans-unit.target: Replace {api-version} with 2015-06-01 in the URI.

trans-unit.source: JSON
trans-unit.target: JSON

trans-unit.source: Element name
trans-unit.target: Element name

trans-unit.source: Required
trans-unit.target: Required

trans-unit.source: Notes
trans-unit.target: Notes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Value may be JobStartTime, CustomTime, or LastOutputEventTime to indicate whether the starting point of the output event stream should either start whenever the job is started, start at a custom user time stamp specified via the <system>outputStartTime</system> property, or start from the last event output time.
trans-unit.target: Value may be JobStartTime, CustomTime, or LastOutputEventTime to indicate whether the starting point of the output event stream should either start whenever the job is started, start at a custom user time stamp specified via the <system>outputStartTime</system> property, or start from the last event output time.

trans-unit.source: If the property is absent, the default is JobStartTime.
trans-unit.target: If the property is absent, the default is JobStartTime.

trans-unit.source: The <system>outputStartMode</system> property can be set to LastOutputEventTime only when <system>GetStreamingJobResponse</system> from the <system>GetStreamingJob</system> request has LastOutputEventTime set, meaning there was at least one output event generated from the streaming job previously.
trans-unit.target: The <system>outputStartMode</system> property can be set to LastOutputEventTime only when <system>GetStreamingJobResponse</system> from the <system>GetStreamingJob</system> request has LastOutputEventTime set, meaning there was at least one output event generated from the streaming job previously.

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Value is either an ISO-8601 formatted time stamp that indicates the starting point of the output event stream, or null to indicate that the output event stream will start whenever the streaming job is started.
trans-unit.target: Value is either an ISO-8601 formatted time stamp that indicates the starting point of the output event stream, or null to indicate that the output event stream will start whenever the streaming job is started.

trans-unit.source: This property must have a value if <system>outputStartMode</system> is set to CustomTime.
trans-unit.target: This property must have a value if <system>outputStartMode</system> is set to CustomTime.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: Status code: 202
trans-unit.target: Status code: 202

trans-unit.source: This is an asynchronous operation that returns a status of 202 until the job has successfully started.
trans-unit.target: This is an asynchronous operation that returns a status of 202 until the job has successfully started.

trans-unit.source: The <system>Location</system> response header contains the URI that is used to obtain the status of the process.
trans-unit.target: The <system>Location</system> response header contains the URI that is used to obtain the status of the process.

trans-unit.source: While the process is running, a call to the URI in the <system>Location</system> header returns a status of 202.
trans-unit.target: While the process is running, a call to the URI in the <system>Location</system> header returns a status of 202.

trans-unit.source: When the process finishes, the URI in the <system>Location</system> header returns a status of 200.
trans-unit.target: When the process finishes, the URI in the <system>Location</system> header returns a status of 200.

trans-unit.source: To get a more detailed status of the job progress, use the <embeddedLabel>Get Information about a Stream Analytics Job</embeddedLabel> operation.
trans-unit.target: To get a more detailed status of the job progress, use the <embeddedLabel>Get Information about a Stream Analytics Job</embeddedLabel> operation.

trans-unit.source: The job response returned will include a <system>jobState</system> property.
trans-unit.target: The job response returned will include a <system>jobState</system> property.
